title.rendered: Noise Level At Ekana During LSG vs CSK Reach MASSIVE Heights When MS Dhoni Comes Out To Bat

content.rendered:
The Ekana Stadium in Lucknow was alive with joy as MS Dhoni stepped into the bat in the match between Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) and Chennai Super Kings. Quinton de Kock’s wife Sasha captured a moment that showed how the crowd was falling, sharing a photo on Instagram from her smartwatch on April 19, Friday. The clock displayed a sound level of 95 decibels, loud enough to cause temporary hearing loss in just 10 minutes.

Sasha’s Instagram story isn’t just about showing off the noise level. It also includes a warning from the smartwatch: “Environmental noise. The sound level is up to 95 decibels. Just 10 minutes at this level can cause temporary tinnitus.” This warning about the potential dangers of such noise caught everyone’s attention.

Meanwhile, MS Dhoni is the star of the film, impressing the audience with a display of skill and power that reminds fans of his youth. Arriving as Chennai were struggling at 141 for 6 with just 13 balls left in their innings, Dhoni quickly made his presence felt.

In typical fashion, Dhoni opened with a four, followed quickly by a powerful six. The highlight of the day for Dhoni was a massive 101-yard six that brought the spectators to their feet. He didn’t stop there, hitting more boundaries to complete a remarkable innings. His blistering 28 off just 9 balls helped Chennai Super Kings reach a tournament total of 176. In the end, LSG won by eight wickets.

Read Also: KL Rahul said MS Dhoni is special person for entire India.
